JSONSchema.title: Identification of AI systems and high-impact algorithms

outputNoAI.title: Result
outputNoAI.default: Based on your answers, your application is not an AI system or high-impact algorithm.

outputAI.title: Result
outputAI.default: Based on your answers, your application is an AI system under the AI Act. Complete the following questionnaire to determine which requirements of the AI Act your application must comply with.

outputAlgorithm.title: Result
outputAlgorithm.default: Based on your answers, your application is a high-impact algorithm. The algorithm must be registered in a algorithm register and adhere to internal algorithm policies.

outputAlgorithmAndAI.title: Result
outputAlgorithmAndAI.default:
Based on your answers, your application is a high-impact algorithm. The algorithm must be registered in a algorithm register and adhere to internal algorithm policies.
Your application is based on your answers most likely also an AI system according to the AI Act. Complete the following questionnaire to determine which requirements of the AI Act your application must comply with.

outputIntermediateAISystem.title: Result
outputIntermediateAISystem.default: Based on your answers, your application is an AI system according to the AI Act. It may also qualify as a high-impact algorithm. Complete the following questionnaire to find out.

q7.title: Which of the following options best describes your application's impact on its outcome?
enum: The outcome of the process is generated solely by the application without human intervention. Once the proces is complete, a human analyst can review and evaluate the results.

The outcome of the process is heavily influenced by the application. For instance, because work prescription determine what the effect is of certain outcomes of the application. A human analyst can deviate from the outcome, but most often does the outcome of the application determine the outcome of the process.

The outcome of the process is partly influenced by the application. The outcome of the application is important for the outcome, but the ultimate decision is taken by a human analyst. This analyst has sufficient information, knowledge/experience, mandate and available time to take the decision.
The outcome of the process is fully determined by a human analyst and is influenced by multiple factors. The result of the application is one of many factors and is not decisive in the decision.
Another type of output
The outcome of the process is fully determined by a human analyst and is influenced by multiple factors. The result of the application is one of many factors and is not decisive in the decision.
Another type of output

q4.title: Is in the process a decision made for individual citizens or civil servants?
enum: Yes
No
Yes

q5.title:
What type of decision is taken in the process?

Select the option that most closely resembles the type of decision.
enum: Decision on the prioritization of applications, requests, complaints, and objections.
Decision on formal complaints and objections

Decision with direct financial consequences for a citizen or civil servant,
such as decisions regarding benefits, allowances, subsidies, fines, refunds, or the possibility of a payment plan.

Decision on applications and requests without direct financial consequences,
such as the approval of a service request or the granting of a permit.
Decision on inspection, investigation, or requests for additional information
Decision on school assignments.
Decisions on providing advice or (proactively) offering services or provisions.
Other type of decisions
No

I am not sure
No

q1.title: What type of output does the application derive?
enum: An estimated score, ranking or probability

An estimated label or classification (such as yes/no, high/low) or allocation to groups
(for instance, for routing, communication purposes or risk classification)
A recommendation
A decision
Content, such as written text, video, audio or images

A dashboard or graph with straight-forward data visualisation
(if on this dashboard one of the above options are displayed, select this option)
Another type of output
Another type of output

q2.title: Does the application contain a model or decision rule that is derived from data?
enum: Yes, the model or algorithm is manually created, but insights from data-analysis have been used for design choices
Yes, the model or algorithm is derived from data with help of statistics, optimalisation, simulation, machine learning or similar methods
No
Yes, the model or algorithm is manually created, but insights from data-analysis have been used for design choices

q2_yes1.title: Explain how the algorithm was developed and the role data analysis played in influencing its design.

q3.title: Is the application an automation of rules defined by humans?
enum: Yes, the application is a straightforward automation of rules defined in law, regulation, or formal policy
Yes, automatisation of rules, but these are not explicitly defined in law, regulation, or formal policy
Yes, logic- and knowledge-based approaches in which output are infered from encoded knowledge or symbolic representation
No
Yes, the application is a straightforward automation of rules defined in law, regulation, or formal policy

q3_no.title: Give a description of the design of the application.

outputIntermediate.title: Next step
outputIntermediate.default:
The following questions pertain to the process in which the application is used. For answering these questions, focus on how the application is integrated into the overall process.

For these questions, the application's role in the decision-making process is not relevant.

q2.ui:description: Data encompasses all forms of electronic information, including text, images, and audio. Various types of algorithms can be derived from data. In rule-based algorithms, thresholds for (decision) rules or weighting factors for decisions can be calculated from data. Classical statistical models, such as regression models, are also derived from data. Machine learning is used to train a model from data. Large language models, such as ChatGPT, utilize machine learning.

q3.ui:description:
An example of rules established in laws or regulations is a rule-based algorithm that automatically determines whether the income and asset requirements are met when applying for social assistance. In this case, the rules in the algorithm are a direct implementation of norms set, for instance, in the Dutch Participation Act.

When a standard is not clearly defined in legislation and is interpreted, the application is not a one-to-one automation of the law or regulation.

Examples of rules created by humans include a rule-based algorithm where a work instruction is translated into a decision rule, a risk profile where the rules are manually created based on employees' experience, or legal standards that are further specified into rules.

Logic- and knowledge-based approaches are also known as symbolic AI systems. These types of AI systems include knowledge representation, inductive (logical) programming, knowledge bases, inference and deduction machines, and (symbolic) reasoning. These forms of technology are rare.

q4.ui:description:
Consider prioritization, follow-up on a question or request from a citizen. For example, whether or not to request additional information from a citizen, whether or not to select for inspection or control, whether or not to (proactively) offer a specific provision in the context of social assistance, etc.

**Note: A decision is much broader than a formal decision as defined in the National Administrative Law.**

q7.ui:description: If in doubt, choose the top option among those you are unsure about.
